subject: VisualAge JUnit
msgSnippet: JUnit Group, I m new to the group and new to VisualAge but not to Java and JUnit.  I ve installed JUnit as a VisualAge tool, but I cannot get it to run any
messageBody:
JUnit Group,

I'm new to the group and new to VisualAge but not to Java and JUnit. I've
installed JUnit as a VisualAge tool, but I cannot get it to run any tests
that rely on classes in the J2EE environment. Specifically, the following
code runs fine inside of VisualAge:

public static void main(String[] args) {
try
{
Properties p = new Properties() ;
p.put( Context.PROVIDER_URL, "iiop://localhost:900/" );
p.put( Context.INITIAL_CONTEXT_FACTORY,
"com.ibm.ejs.ns.jndi.CNInitialContextFactory" ) ;
InitialContext context = new InitialContext( p ) ;
assertEquals( true, true ) ;
System.out.println( "Finished OK" ) ;
}
catch( Exception e )
{
e.printStackTrace() ;
}
}

However the following code thows a NoClassDefFound Exception inside of JUnit
which is running inside of VisualAge ( From the tool menu ). The offending
character is the line - InitialContext context = new InitialContext( p ) ;

public void testHelloAdam() {
try
{
Properties p = new Properties() ;
p.put( Context.PROVIDER_URL, "iiop://localhost:900/" );
p.put( Context.INITIAL_CONTEXT_FACTORY,
"com.ibm.ejs.ns.jndi.CNInitialContextFactory" ) ;
InitialContext context = new InitialContext( p ) ;
assertEquals( true, true ) ;
}
catch( Exception e )
{
e.printStackTrace() ;
}
}

I've set up proper classpaths to javax.naming.*, but it seems that the JUnit
framework doesn't pick this up inside of VA.

Also, installation instructions refer to a default.ini in the distribution,
but I couldn't locate it so I wrote my own. Could that be the problem?

Thanks,
Adam Pelletier
